headline: Amkor, Nova, Intel, and Amtech Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the afternoon session after markets faded the Nvidia rally in the morning session, as investors remained uncertain about future rate cuts.

headline: US lawmakers target Chinese chipmaking equipment imports by CHIPS Act grant recipients
summary: PHOENIX (Reuters) -A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers introduced a bill on Thursday in the House that ​would block the purchase of Chinese chipmaking equipment by CHIPS Act grant recipients for ‌10 years.  The bill targets a range of chipmaking tools from complex lithography equipment, like that produced by Dutch manufacturer ‌ASML, to machines that slice and dice the silicon wafers on which chips are printed.  The bill was introduced in the House by Republican Jay Obernolte and Democratic member Zoe Lofgren.

The bill targets a range of chipmaking tools from complex lithography equipment, like that produced by Dutch manufacturer ‌ASML, to machines that slice and dice the silicon wafers on which chips are printed.  The bill was introduced in the House by Republican Jay Obernolte and Democratic member Zoe Lofgren.

headline: Intel Could Be the Biggest Winner of TSMC’s AI Bottleneck
summary: The AI industry's demand for chips is creating a supply bottleneck, positioning Intel's growing foundry business for significant long-term growth.

raw.headline: Intel Could Be the Biggest Winner of TSMC’s AI Bottleneck
raw.summary: The AI industry's demand for chips is creating a supply bottleneck, positioning Intel's growing foundry business for significant long-term growth.

headline: ASML launches technical academy in Phoenix to train in-demand engineers
summary: PHOENIX (Reuters) -Chip equipment maker ASML on Thursday launched a technical academy in Phoenix to train engineers to service the Dutch ​company's complex chipmaking machines.  Located within a few minutes of the Phoenix airport,‌ the facility is designed to train more than 1,000 engineers a year to repair and service ASML’s chipmaking ‌tools.  ASML decided to open the academy because of the significant increase in advanced chip manufacturing in the United States.

headline: Big chipmakers evaluating Intel’s foundry but Citi doubts deals will materialise
summary: Investing.com -- Several large chipmakers including Qualcomm, Broadcom and Apple appear to be evaluating Intel’s foundry and packaging technologies but Citi analysts do not expect any of the possible engagements to become meaningful given Intel’s technical challenges and its lag behind TSMC.

raw.headline: Big chipmakers evaluating Intel’s foundry but Citi doubts deals will materialise

headline: Layoffs are piling up, raising worker anxiety. Here are some companies that have cut jobs recently
summary: It’s a tough time to be looking for a job.  Amid wider economic uncertainty, some analysts have said that businesses are at a “no-hire, no fire” standstill.  Others cite corporate restructuring more broadly — or, as seen with big names like Amazon, are redirecting money to artificial intelligence.

headline: Why Nvidia earnings are boosting these four stocks
summary: Nvidia (NVDA)'s Q3 earnings beat has lifted stocks across the tech sector, including competitors such as Intel (INTC), AMD (AMD) and Broadcom (AVGO). But there are four stocks (000660.KS, 005930.KS, MU, TSM) that are particularly closely linked to Nvidia - and benefitting from its strong performance. Ramzan Karmali explains. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Global tech shares surge as Nvidia's AI boom powers market rally
summary: (Reuters) -Global technology shares rallied on Thursday after Nvidia's blow-out quarterly results signalled that demand for artificial intelligence hardware remains strong even as analysts caution the boom may be outpacing ​fundamentals.  The chip bellwether's stellar results tempered some concerns over a potential AI bubble, although questions lingered around the sustainability of ‌the massive spending boom not paying off as anticipated.  Nvidia is on track to add about $243 billion to its market cap, which is more than entire valuation of companies ‌such as PepsiCo, and Goldman Sachs, if gains hold, with shares up 5% at $196.53 in premarket trading.

raw.headline: Global tech shares surge as Nvidia's AI boom powers market rally

Nvidia is on track to add about $243 billion to its market cap, which is more than entire valuation of companies ‌such as PepsiCo, and Goldman Sachs, if gains hold, with shares up 5% at $196.53 in premarket trading.

headline: Intel (INTC) Is Down 7.3% After Announcing Multi-Year NVIDIA Partnership and $5 Billion Equity Investment
summary: Earlier this month, NVIDIA announced a multi-year partnership with Intel to jointly develop custom data center and PC solutions, alongside a planned US$5 billion equity investment, as Intel executes leadership changes to accelerate its digital transformation and AI initiatives under CEO Lip-Bu Tan. This collaboration not only marks a significant step forward in integrating NVIDIA’s AI and accelerated computing capabilities with Intel’s x86 architecture, but also underscores increasing...
